bug.author: tshrjn
bug.summary: Watching multiple instances of same model class
bug.description:
wandb --version && python --version && uname
Weights and Biases version: 0.8.13 Python version: 3.7.4 Operating System: Linux
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
Trying to watch multiple model instances of the same model class. For example: <denchmark-code>model1 = ResNet18() model2 = ResNet18()
wandb.watch(model1, log='all') wandb.watch(model2, log='all') </denchmark-code>
And getting the following error on the line watching model2: <denchmark-code>ValueError: A hook has already been set under name "gradients/layer1.0.weight" </denchmark-code>
This looks like is happening because layer1.0 already exists. The gradients should also have the variable name of the model to resolve this issue. Edit: Complete Traceback: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/tushar/.vscode-server/extensions/ms-python.python-2019.10.41019/pythonFiles/ptvsd_launcher.py", line 43, in <module> main(ptvsdArgs) File "/home/tushar/.vscode-server/extensions/ms-python.python-2019.10.41019/pythonFiles/lib/python/old_ptvsd/ptvsd/__main__.py", line 432, in main run() File "/home/tushar/.vscode-server/extensions/ms-python.python-2019.10.41019/pythonFiles/lib/python/old_ptvsd/ptvsd/__main__.py", line 316, in run_file runpy.run_path(target, run_name='__main__') File "/home/tushar/anaconda3/envs/pytorch_env/lib/python3.7/runpy.py", line 263, in run_path pkg_name=pkg_name, script_name=fname) File "/home/tushar/anaconda3/envs/pytorch_env/lib/python3.7/runpy.py", line 96, in _run_module_code mod_name, mod_spec, pkg_name, script_name) File "/home/tushar/anaconda3/envs/pytorch_env/lib/python3.7/runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code exec(code, run_globals) File "/home/tushar/some_py_torch_project/train.py", line 67, in <module> wandb.watch(encoder2, log='all') File "/home/tushar/anaconda3/envs/3d_mesh/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/__init__.py", line 143, in watch model, log_parameters=log_parameters, log_gradients=log_gradients, prefix=prefix, log_freq=log_freq) File "/home/tushar/anaconda3/envs/pytorch_env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/wandb_torch.py", line 112, in add_log_hooks_to_pytorch_module parameter, 'gradients/' + prefix + name, log_track_grad) File "/home/tushar/anaconda3/envs/pytorch_env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/wandb_torch.py", line 196, in _hook_variable_gradient_stats 'A hook has already been set under name "{}"'.format(name)) ValueError: A hook has already been set under name "gradients/layer1.0.weight" </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.77. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tshrjn>@tshrjn</denchmark-link> : thank you for this bug report we just added the ability to call wandb.watch multiple times in a run and it looks like there is an issue with namespaces. If you use the old behavior of running: wandb.watch([model1, model2], log='all') Then your program will not crash

Thanks a ton for your quick response. That did the trick! üëç Also, In my opinion having a name argument for the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client/blob/master/wandb/__init__.py#L107>watch</denchmark-link> function would be a good idea since anyway, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client/blob/master/wandb/wandb_torch.py#L82>add_log_hooks_to_pytorch_module</denchmark-link> in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client/blob/master/wandb/wandb_torch.py>wandb_torch.py</denchmark-link> , which <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client/blob/master/wandb/__init__.py#L142>called</denchmark-link> for this purpose, already has the name argument to be used as a prefix.

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tshrjn>@tshrjn</denchmark-link> we just released 0.8.14 which fixes the case of calling wandb.watch() multiple times. We didn't add a name propery yet, but likely will in a future release.
